title: TE2 – Tunnelling Construction | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design
TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment
TE1 is not a prerequisite for TE2 and TE3. TE2 is not a prerequisite for TE3.
Logistic and supply chain for mechanised tunnelling
Guide to tunnel rings and segments
Construction safety, fire safety, ventilation, and environmental control during tunnelling
Guide to tunnelling TBM parameters during construction
Sprayed concrete lining and open face tunnelling
Cavern design and construction, drill and blast
Case History for mechansied tunnelling and conventional (SCL) tunnelling.
Refer to “Guidelines to Sit for Specialist Registration Examination and Register as Specialist Professional Engineer in the Specialized Branch of Tunnelling Engineering (Oct 2020)”:
Civil engineers who are registered professional engineers with the Professional Engineers Board Singapore (PEB) and who wish to be certified as Specialist in Tunnel Engineering
Engineers who are involved with tunnel constructions such as geotechnical engineers, civil engineers, site engineers, field engineers, project engineers and construction managers
This course is very useful for those who are working in the tunnelling industry. I highly recommend this course.
Technical Director, Mott Macdonald Singapore Pte Ltd
Introduction to mechanised tunnelling and excavation methods in soil and in rock
Application of bored tunnelling in Singapore for the construction of MRT, roads, services, sewer, etc.
Challenges when tunnelling in an urban environment
Overview of TBM tunneling in close mode
New technologies and latest development in bored tunnelling
Design principles of Slurry and EPB TBMs and their components
Cutterhead configuration and replacement of cutting tool
Logistic and Supply Chain for Mechanised Tunnelling
Rolling stock and temporary rail tracks
Segmental Lining Fabrication, Installation and Quality Control
Segment casting: Static VS carousel systems
Ring selection and installation, quality control and repair
Construction Safety, Fire Safety, Ventilation, and Environmental Control During Tunnelling
Ventilation and air quality in tunnel
Interpretation of Tunnelling Parameters During Construction
Main TBM components and how they contribute to the tunnelling process
Understanding of the TBM operational parameters (including; torque, thrust, face pressure, advance speed, penetration) and their correlation to tunnelling performance
Case studies involving analysis of TBM data
Working in Compressed Air and Related Regulations
The use of compressed air in tunnelling, why and how
Health hazards associated with compressed air interventions
Planning and execution of compressed air interventions
Typical profiles in soil or rock (circular, oval, horseshoe) and excavation sequences (full face, sequential excavation method, multi drifts, pilots and enlargement)
Temporary supports (shotcrete, wire mesh, lattice girders, steel arches, rock bolts, soil bolts etc.)
Pre-support: pipe roofing, forepoling, face nailing, etc.
Shotcrete application: Mix design, use of additives, wet and dry shotcrete techniques, manual and robotic application
Shotcrete testing: trial test and testing the work
Cavern Design and Construction, Drill and Blast
rock support system (rock bolts and shotcrete)
water control in rock excavation and design
drill and blast method and blasting vibrations
Overview of grouting and its applications to tunnelling
Application of horizontal grouting for tunnelling in soil and rock
Special grouting techniques, as jet grouting, fissure grouting, TAM grouting, chemical grouting etc.
Grout material, grout testing and termination criteria
Case history for mechanised tunnelling and conventional (SCL) tunnelling.

Dr. Sigl graduated as Diploma Engineer (MSc) in 1985 from the Technical University of Graz (Austria), in geotechnics and soil mechanics and in 1991 he achieved the PhD in mining engineering at the Mining University of Leoben (Austria). Oskar’s 30 years of experience cover a wide range of projects such as subways, railways, roads, power transmission cables, sewerage mains, underground storage schemes and caverns. Oskar has been working in Singapore since 1997, where he was involved in the detailed design of almost all major underground infra structure projects. This includes the MRT lines, high voltage transmission cable tunnels, underground expressways and deep sewer tunnels. Outside of Singapore, Dr. Sigl was involved in leading roles in the design of underground transportation systems in Dubai, Perth, Brisbane, Sydney, Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur as well as the design of underground oil and fuel storage cavern schemes in Saudi Arabia, India and the UAE.

Mr Ow Chun Nam has over 40 years of experience in public infrastructure projects, specialising in deep excavations, mechanised and mined tunnelling. He has seen through various rail and road projects including the North-East Line, Circle Line, Downtown Line and Kallang-Paya Lebar Expressway. He presently leads LTA’s Tunnelling sub-Group in the construction of the Thomson-East Coast Line and the upcoming Cross-Island Line. Chun Nam has been a Professional Engineer (Civil) registered with the Singapore Professional Engineers Board since 1983. He is also an Honorary Member and ex-President of the Tunnelling and Underground Construction Society Singapore (TUCSS) and ex-Executive Council Member of the International Tunnelling Association (ITA). In the course of his career, he has served as an advisor to SP PowerAssets Limited for the Transmission Cable Tunnel Project and to PUB for the Stamford Diversion Canal and PUB’s Deep Tunnel Sewerage System (DTSS) Phase 2. Currently, he is a senior technical advisor at Obayashi Corporation.
Senior Project Manager, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority
Senior Project Manager, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority

Jim Yee graduated from the Nanyang Technological of University Singapore with a Degree of Bachelor of Engineering (Civil) in 2002. He embarked on his civil engineering career in supervision and subsequently in design of underground structures and tunnelling works. He joined the Land Transport Authority Singapore (LTA) in 2015.  Throughout his 19 years of working experience, he was involved in the design and supervision, tendering and award as well as project implementation in tunnelling works. Past tunnelling projects include Circle Line 4, Downtown Line 2, Downtown Line 3, Thomson-East Coast Line C2, which involved the deployment of both Slurry and EPB TBM. He is currently seconded to MSI Global Pte Ltd as principal consultant in PUB DTSS 2 projects on tunnelling and tunnel related construction works.
Deputy Director, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority
Deputy Director, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority

Ramesh joined the Land Transport Authority (LTA) in 1993 upon graduating with 2nd Class Honours from the National University of Singapore (NUS). He holds a MSc (Civil Engineering) from NUS and has been awarded the NSTB (Now called A*STAR) gold medal in 1997. Ramesh is currently Deputy Director of the LTA Tunnelling Team, leading a group of over 30 staff to manage the tunnelling works. He was involved in numerous projects during his career, and has vast experience working with both Slurry and Earth Pressure Balanced Tunnel Boring Machines). His MRT construction experiences was accumulated through the wide range scope of managing North East Line, Kallang-Paya Lebar Expressway, Circle Line 4, Downtown Line 3 and the recent Thomson–East Coast line right from the initial design, tendering, awarding of civil contracts and project implementation. He is currently involved in the upcoming North East Line Extension and proposed Cross Island Line.
Deputy Director, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority
Deputy Director, Tunnelling, Land Transport Authority

A graduate Mining Engineer & Tunnelling Industry professional with over 32 years’ experience in all aspects of tunnel construction and management. A practitioner with over 16 years spent working for multinational main contractors on tunnelling projects in Europe, Asia and Africa. This has been followed by over 15 years working for the client / developer LTA as part of a team responsible for the construction of underground rail systems within Singapore. He holds a Bachelor of Engineering Honours Degree from Imperial Collage, is a Chartered Civil Engineer and a Fellow of the Institute of Civil Engineers. He is a committee member of ICE Singapore where he is Geotechnical & Tunnels interest group lead. Project involvement in Singapore: NEL (Contractor), DTSS (Contractor), Link-Sewer (Contractor) CCL5, SPPG Cable Tunnel (advisory), DTL2, TEL5&6, CCL6 (Design & Tender), TELe (Design), CRL1.
Deputy Director, Geotechnical & Tunnels Division B; Assistant Chief Specialist – Infrastructure Specialist and CentEx for Tunneling, Land Transport Authority Singapore
Deputy Director, Geotechnical & Tunnels Division B; Assistant Chief Specialist – Infrastructure Specialist and CentEx for Tunneling, Land Transport Authority Singapore

Dr Veeresh has 20 years of experience in Geotechnical Engineering in areas of  Design of deep excavations,  Bored tunnels, NATM tunnels temporary support in soils and rocks, deep foundations, shallow foundations, and stabilization of slopes and soil improvement techniques. He worked for the various projects in several countries which include  Singapore, Malaysia, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Australia, Vietnam, Sri Lanka and India and he worked with Clients, Contractors and consultants .  He holds Master of Technology in geotechnical engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras India. and a Doctor of Philosophy from Indian Institute of Technology.  Dr Veeresh has co-authored about 29 technical publications in journals and conferences.
Senior Sales Manager, Raito Kogyo Co Ltd
Senior Sales Manager, Raito Kogyo Co Ltd

In 20 years of his career at Raito Kogyo Co. Ltd., a leading geotechnical contractor in Japan, he has worked as a technical specialist in construction management, technical development, and technical studies for slope stabilisation works. He was also involved in land slide prevention and ground improvement, which include tunnel-related works.

He was also an inventor and contributed to the development of several patented technologies in the slope stabilisation field. As a collaborative researcher, he has two years of experience supporting the landslide team of the Public Works Research Institute, Japan. In Japan, he is a professional engineer in soil mechanics and foundations and is an international member of the International Society for Soil Mechanics and Geotechnical Engineering. He holds a bachelor of civil engineering from Hokkaido University, a master of structural and geotechnical engineering from Hokkaido University, and a PhD in engineering from Kobe University.
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake non-credit bearing assessment during the course
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass the final examination
The full fee for this course is S$2,398.00.
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
The Learn for Life token may be used for this course
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

Readying SIT's Civil Engineering Graduates for the Future Workforce
SIT's lifelong learning division lays the foundation for Class of 2020 Civil Engineering graduates to attain their Professional Engineering qualification.
This module provides an overview of Singapore geology, soil and rock behaviour, site investigation, and evaluation of field and laboratory test results.
CVE6002 Design of Steel and Composite Structures
This module covers fundamental approaches to designing steel-concrete composite buildings in accordance with EC4.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.
This module covers structural stability, dynamic problems, and developing fundamental equations in civil engineering.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design
This is the first module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
This module deep dives into the design of shallow and piled foundations, and how they minimise the risk of catastrophic failure and excessive settlement.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
